div.p: Expansion based on codesystem Définition des types de titre pour l'essai v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)
Main title for common use. The primary title used for representation if multiple titles exist.
The official or authoritative title.
Title using scientific terminology.
Title using language common to lay public discourse.
Subtitle or secondary title.
Brief title (e.g. 'running title' or title used in page headers)
Abbreviation used as title

tr.td: Different text in an earlier version

div.p: Alternative form of title in an earlier version such as epub ahead of print.
Additional form of title in a different language.
Machine translated form of title in a different language, language element codes the language into which it was translated by machine.
Human-friendly title
Machine-friendly title

tr.td: Different text for the same object with a different identifier

div.p: An alternative form of the title in two or more entries, e.g. in multiple medline entries

display.value: Different text in an earlier version
Different text for the same object with a different identifier

div.p: This value set contains 9 concepts

div.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px
div.p: Expansion based on:

li.a: codesystem Définition des type de phase de l'essai cliniques incluant https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-research-study-phase.html v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

div.p: Trials without phases (for example, studies of devices or behavioral interventions).

Designation for optional exploratory trials conducted in accordance with the United States Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) 2006 Guidance on Exploratory Investigational New Drug (IND) Studies. Formerly called Phase 0.

Includes initial studies to determine the metabolism and pharmacologic actions of drugs in humans, the side effects associated with increasing doses, and to gain early evidence of effectiveness; may include healthy participants and/or patients.
Trials that are a combination of phases 1 and 2.

Includes controlled clinical studies conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of the drug for a particular indication or indications in participants with the disease or condition under study and to determine the common short-term side effects and risks.
Trials that are a combination of phases 2 and 3.

Includes trials conducted after preliminary evidence suggesting effectiveness of the drug has been obtained, and are intended to gather additional information to evaluate the overall benefit-risk relationship of the drug.
Studies of FDA-approved drugs to delineate additional information including the drug's risks, benefits, and optimal use.
Trials that are a combination of phases III and IV.

title.value: Value Set type de phase de l'essai clinique
